intro: Epilobium californicum var. holosericeum, commonly known as the California willow-herb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows, stream banks, and wetlands. It has slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its botanical features make it an important species for pollinators and a valuable component of native plant communities.
